英文法規名稱: Regulations Governing Immunization Operation, Examination of Children’s Immunization Record, and Catch-up Immunization
中文法規名稱: 預防接種作業與兒童預防接種紀錄檢查及補行接種辦法
沿革內容:
1.Formulated in 9 articles and announced jointly on November 28, 2002, by the Department of Health, the Executive Yuan, under Shu-Chi-Guan No. 0910064458, Ministry of the Interior under Tai-Nei-Tung No. 0910002264, and Ministry of Education under Tai (91) Ti No. 91168668
2.Amended Article 1 and announced jointly on May 18, 2004, by the Department of Health, the Executive Yuan, under Shu-Shou-Chi No. 0930000316, Ministry of the Interior under Tai-Nei-Tung No. 0930093811, and Ministry of Education under Tai-Ti No. 0930061812B
3.Amended the title and seven articles and announced on April 15, 2008, by the Department of Health, the Executive Yuan, under Shu-Shou-Chi No. 0970000246 (original title: Regulations Governing the Inspection of Immunization Records of Children and Catch-up Immunization)
4.Amended Article 2 and announced by the Department of Health, the Executive Yuan, on December 6, 2011, under Shu-Shou-Chi Order No. 1000101169
5.Amended Article 7 and Appendix of Article 4 and announced by the Department of Health, the Executive Yuan, on February 21, 2012, under Shu-Shou-Chi Order No. 1010100125

法規內容.條文內容: This set of Regulations is formulated in accordance with regulations of Paragraph 2, Article 28 of the Communicable Disease Control Act.
Nursing personnel, when implementing immunization, shall truly follow necessary assessment processes, and by regulations, report and issue records.

Schedules and items of immunization that new enrollees of primary schools and pre-school educational (care) institutions (hereafter referred to as primary schools and educational institutions) shall complete are as per Attachment.

Authority and responsibility of the examination of immunization record and make-up immunization are shared as follows:
1. Examination of immunization records shall be made by primary schools and educational institutions.
2. Make-up immunization shall be conducted by competent health authorities.

This set of Regulations, with the exception of Article 2 amended and announced on April 15, 2008 that shall be implemented on November 1, 2008, shall be implemented on the day of announcement.
The attached “Schedule and Items of Immunization Required for New Enrollees of Elementary Schools and Pre-School Educational (Care) Institutions was amended on February 21, 2012 and becomes effective on March 1, 2012.
